SEARCH
Package risk.client.network

Klasse ClientMain

java.lang.Object
risk.client.network.ClientMain
Alle implementierten Schnittstellen:
RiskInterface
public class ClientMain extends Object implements RiskInterface
The `ClientMain2` class is responsible for managing the client-side network operations of the Risk game. It implements the `RiskInterface` and handles communication with the game server, including sending requests, receiving responses, and notifying listeners about game events.

Key functionalities include:

  • Connecting to the server and initializing input/output streams
  • Listening for server messages and handling different server commands
  • Managing the current player's state and game data
  • Notifying game event listeners about various game events
  • Providing methods for player actions such as attacking, moving units, and interacting with country and mission data

This class is integral to the client-side game logic and ensures real-time synchronization with the server, facilitating a seamless multiplayer experience.

    • getMissionCard

      public void getMissionCard()
      Requests a mission card for the current player from the server. Sends a request with the player's name to receive the mission card and assigns it to the player.

    • getUnitCards

      public void getUnitCards()
      Requests unit cards for the current player from the server. Sends a request with the player's name to receive unit cards and adds them to the player's unit card collection.

    • makeAttack

      public void makeAttack(String fromCou, String toCou, String attacker, int numberOfUnits)
      Initiates an attack command to the server. Sends a command to attack from one country to another with specified units and attacker.
      Angegeben von:
      makeAttack in Schnittstelle RiskInterface
      Parameter:
      fromCou - The name of the attacking country.
      toCou - The name of the defending country.
      attacker - The name of the player initiating the attack.
      numberOfUnits - The number of units used in the attack.

    • moveUnits

      public String moveUnits(String player, String fromCountry, String toCountry, int units)
      Requests to move units from one country to another for a specified player. Sends a request to move units with the player's name, source country, destination country, and number of units.
      Angegeben von:
      moveUnits in Schnittstelle RiskInterface
      Parameter:
      player - The name of the player requesting to move units.
      fromCountry - The name of the country from which units are being moved.
      toCountry - The name of the country to which units are being moved.
      units - The number of units to move.
      Gibt zurück:
      An empty string (placeholder for future implementation).

    • turnInUnitCards

      public String turnInUnitCards(String player, String card1, String card2, String card3)
      Requests to turn in unit cards for a player to the server. Sends a request with the player's name and three unit card identifiers.
      Angegeben von:
      turnInUnitCards in Schnittstelle RiskInterface
      Parameter:
      player - The name of the player turning in the unit cards.
      card1 - The identifier of the first unit card to turn in.
      card2 - The identifier of the second unit card to turn in.
      card3 - The identifier of the third unit card to turn in.
      Gibt zurück:
      "Success" if turning in the unit cards is successful, "Failed" otherwise. Returns an empty string if an IOException occurs during communication.

      Angegeben von:
      addPlayerUnitsToCountry in Schnittstelle RiskInterface

      units - The number of units to add to the country.
      Gibt zurück:
      An empty string (placeholder for future implementation).
      Löst aus:
      InvalidUnitException - If the number of units to add is invalid.
